captures.text: Google just quietly dropped WebMCP — and most people are reading it as 'another Chrome API.' It's not. It's Chrome telling AI agents: here's how to actually use websites. Two new APIs: Declarative — standard actions defined in HTML forms. Imperative — complex interactions requiring JavaScript execution.
captures.whyInteresting: Best technical breakdown of WebMCP — the protocol layer for the agentic web

captures.text: WebMCP is the HTTP moment for AI agents. Sites declare tools directly instead of agents guessing buttons. 25x fewer tokens, 50x faster actions.
Why OpenAI Should Build Slack — editorial arguing for multiplayer agent interface
captures.whyInteresting: swyx essay on agent UX future, notes Anthropic more cohesive strategy than OpenAI

captures.text: GPT-5.2 spending 12 hours reasoning through a physics proof is the most interesting benchmark result this year. forget coding evals — independently deriving what took decades of human intuition is a different category entirely
captures.whyInteresting: Best take on GPT-5.2 physics breakthrough

captures.text: VIRTUALS integrating OpenClaw agents + ERC-8004 for identity and reputation + $1M funding for agent monetization

captures.text: Always-on agents are the real battleground. Skills + subagents + persistent memory + dedicated compute + identity + messengers — that's an operating system for AI workers
